## Conversation that answers the provided questions:
**User:**
I'm interested in learning more about how Verus works, specifically with regards to fees and crowdfunding launches. Can you tell me about the relationship between fees generated on a new blockchain and the Verus blockchain?

**AI Assistant:**
Fees generated via cross-chain fee conversions or general use of the liquidity pool on a new blockchain are earned on that blockchain, with no rent going back to the Verus blockchain. This means that the new blockchain retains full control over its fees, and there is no revenue sharing with the Verus blockchain. Does that make sense? Do you have any further questions about fees on Verus?

**User:**
That's helpful, thanks! I'm also interested in crowdfunding currency launches on Verus. How do they work, and what happens if the minimum participation levels are not met?

**AI Assistant:**
On Verus, blockchain-based crowdfunding currency launches allow you to set required minimum levels of worldwide participation in your preferred currencies on chain. If the minimum participation levels are not met by the start time of your blockchain, all participants will automatically receive a refund of all their pre-conversions, minus network fees. This ensures that participants are protected in case the launch is not successful. Does that answer your question? Do you have any more about crowdfunding on Verus?

**User:**
That's really interesting. Are there any features available for customizing a crowdfunding currency launch on Verus?

**AI Assistant:**
Yes, Verus provides several features to customize a crowdfunding currency launch, including: setting maximum participation in one or more currencies, offering pre-launch discounts, making price-neutral pre-allocations to select IDs, providing price-neutral carve-outs of proceeds, and offering pre-launch discounts for early participants. Additionally, launches can include vesting schedules in the pre-allocations using VerusIDs. These features give you a lot of flexibility in structuring your crowdfunding launch. Do you have any more questions about customization options?

**User:**
I think I have a good understanding of crowdfunding on Verus now. Can you tell me more about the Verus multi-currency, multi-chain network?

**AI Assistant:**
The Verus multi-currency, multi-chain network is a decentralized network that allows the creation of an unlimited number of interoperable blockchains. This network enables the creation of public blockchains available for merge mining and staking, as well as private, internal blockchains that are easy to set up and bridge with public currencies. The key benefits of this network include unlimited scale, easy setup and bridging of blockchains, and decentralized blockchain-specific bridge confirmation through Notary IDs. Does that help you understand the Verus network better?
What is the relationship between fees generated on a new blockchain and the Verus blockchain?

Fees generated via cross-chain fee conversions or general use of the liquidity pool on a new blockchain are earned on that blockchain, with no rent going back to the Verus blockchain. This means that the new blockchain retains full control over its fees, and there is no revenue sharing with the Verus blockchain.

in, and all fees generated via cross chain fee conversions or general use of the liquidity pool are earned on the new blockchain with no rent going back to the Verus blockchain, only seamless connectivity.
## Blockchain-based, crowdfunding currency launches with minimum participation or automatic refunds, including for dual launches (blockchain and bridge)
- Set required minimum levels of worldwide participation in your preferred currencies on chain. If by the start time of your blockchain, minimums are not met, all participants will automatically get a refund of all of their pre-conversions, less the network fees. The launch options also provide for maximum participation in one or more currencies, pre-launch discounts, price neutral pre-allocations to select IDs that increase the fractional reserve ratio to issue currencies, similarly price neutral carve-outs of proceeds, and pre-launch discounts for early participants. Using VerusIDs, launches can also include vesting schedules in the pre-allocations as well.
## An interoperable, multichain network for new use cases and unlimited scale**
- The Verus multi-currency, multi-chain network allows the creation of an unlimited number of interoperable blockchains in the Verus network. Notary IDs, specified at chain definition, provide decentralized blockchain-specific bridge confirmation, enabling public blockchains available to the world for merge mining and staking, as well as private, internal blockchains, which are easy to setup with easy bridging of public currencies into an organization and onto their internal private network and back, with all features and currencies of the public chain but none of the access. There is no limit on the number of blockchains that may continuously operate and interoperate on the Verus network.
